content:
zoe LaFemina ReporterMay  

At noon on May  SGA president Christopher Pineda delivered the State of the College address to a crowded dining hall at Anne Arundel Community College PERIOD

The State of the College address is delivered once a semester at AACC PERIOD At the address Pineda discussed the many accomplishments of the SGA Campus Activities Board and other student organizations on campus PERIOD

The face of the college has changed said Pineda PERIOD Many initiatives were discussed last semester PERIOD Of those initiatives most of the goals have been completed. among the accomplishments Pineda mentioned were increased participation and attendance at sporting events the introduction of the first Spirit Week at AACC the new mascot the Year of Social Justice and Pinedas presidential legacy the nonsmoking policy which will go into effect July  PERIOD

In addition to the accomplishments of the past semester Pineda also discussed the future of AACCs student government PERIOD He introduced Annalisa Hite who will be president of AACCs SGA next semester PERIOD This is Hites third year at AACC she has been involved in AACCs SGA as well as the Campus Activities Board PERIOD

My goal is to make AACC more unified says Hite PERIOD I want AACC to be a place where people feel welcome and accomplish their goals. brandon Hamilton

Campus Current

The awardwinning newspaper of Anne Arundel Community College PERIOD
